freenet.support.io
Class PaddedEphemerallyEncryptedBucket

java.lang.Object
  freenet.support.io.PaddedEphemerallyEncryptedBucket
All Implemented Interfaces:
Bucket, SerializableToFieldSetBucket
public class PaddedEphemerallyEncryptedBucket
extends Object
implements Bucket, SerializableToFieldSetBucket

A proxy Bucket which adds: - Encryption with the supplied cipher, and a random, ephemeral key. - Padding to the next PO2 size.

Constructor Detail

PaddedEphemerallyEncryptedBucket

public PaddedEphemerallyEncryptedBucket(Bucket bucket,
                                        int minSize,
                                        RandomSource strongPRNG,
                                        Random weakPRNG)
Create a padded encrypted proxy bucket.

Parameters:
bucket - The bucket which we are proxying to. Must be empty.
pcfb - The encryption mode with which to encipher/decipher the data.
minSize - The minimum padded size of the file (after it has been closed).
strongPRNG - a strong prng we will key from.
weakPRNG - a week prng we will padd from. Serialization: Note that it is not our responsibility to free the random number generators, but we WILL free the underlying bucket.
Throws:
UnsupportedCipherException

PaddedEphemerallyEncryptedBucket

public PaddedEphemerallyEncryptedBucket(Bucket bucket,
                                        int minSize,
                                        long knownSize,
                                        byte[] key,
                                        RandomSource origRandom)
                                 throws IOException
Load an existing PaddedEphemerallyEncryptedBucket, with a key. The bucket can and should already exist.

Parameters:
bucket -
minSize -
knownSize - The size of the data. This cannot be deduced from the bucket alone and must be specified. If the bucket is smaller than this, we throw.
key -
origRandom -
Throws:
IOException

Method Detail

getOutputStream

public OutputStream getOutputStream()
                             throws IOException
Description copied from interface: Bucket
Returns an OutputStream that is used to put data in this Bucket, from the beginning. It is not possible to append data to a Bucket! This simplifies the code significantly for some classes. If you need to append, just pass the OutputStream around.

Specified by:
getOutputStream in interface Bucket
Throws:
IOException

getInputStream

public InputStream getInputStream()
                           throws IOException
Description copied from interface: Bucket
Returns an InputStream that reads data from this Bucket. If there is no data in this bucket, null is returned. You have to call Closer.close(inputStream) on the obtained stream to prevent resource leakage.

Specified by:
getInputStream in interface Bucket
Throws:
IOException

removeFrom

public void removeFrom(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
Description copied from interface: Bucket
Remove the bucket and everything under it from the database. You don't need to call this if it hasn't been storeTo()'ed: buckets that use the database internally will run a blocking job to delete internal structure in free().

Specified by:
removeFrom in interface Bucket
Parameters:
container - The database.

objectOnActivate

public void objectOnActivate(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)

createShadow

public Bucket createShadow()
                    throws IOException
Description copied from interface: Bucket
Create a shallow read-only copy of this bucket, using different objects but using the same external storage. If this is not possible, return null. Note that if the underlying bucket is deleted, the copy will become invalid and probably throw an IOException on read, or possibly return too-short data etc. In some use cases e.g. on fproxy, this is acceptable.

Specified by:
createShadow in interface Bucket
Throws:
IOException
